category.name: Aptitude
category.description: Develop mathematical reasoning and problem-solving skills for competitive exams and interviews.

sub_categories.name: Algebra
sub_categories.description: Master algebraic concepts, equations, and mathematical problem-solving techniques.

exercises.title: Advanced Linear Algebra
exercises.description: Solve complex linear algebra problems and matrix operations.

tasks.title: Eigenvalue Calculator
tasks.question:
Implement an eigenvalue and eigenvector calculator for square matrices.

Your function should:

  • Find eigenvalues using characteristic equation
  • Calculate corresponding eigenvectors
  • Handle complex eigenvalues
  • Support diagonalization
  • Return eigenvalues and eigenvectors
tasks.hint: Solve det(A - λI) = 0 for eigenvalues, then solve (A - λI)v = 0 for eigenvectors

tasks.title: Matrix Diagonalization
tasks.question:
When is a matrix diagonalizable?

Consider: Conditions for a matrix to be similar to a diagonal matrix
tasks.hint: Think about the relationship between eigenvalues and eigenvectors
options: When it has n linearly independent eigenvectors - sufficient condition
Only when all eigenvalues are real - necessary condition
Only when matrix is symmetric - sufficient but not necessary

tasks.title: Singular Value Decomposition
tasks.question:
Implement Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) for matrices.

Your function should:

  • Decompose matrix A into UΣV^T
  • Calculate singular values
  • Find left and right singular vectors
  • Handle rectangular matrices
  • Return U, Σ, and V matrices
tasks.hint: Use eigendecomposition of A^T A and AA^T, then construct U, Σ, V

exercises.title: Abstract Algebra Concepts
exercises.description: Work with abstract algebraic structures and concepts.

tasks.title: Group Theory Calculator
tasks.question:
Create a calculator for basic group theory operations.

Your calculator should:

  • Check if a set with operation forms a group
  • Find group generators
  • Calculate group order and element orders
  • Identify subgroups
  • Handle cyclic and permutation groups
tasks.hint: Check closure, associativity, identity, and inverse properties for groups

tasks.title: Group Properties
tasks.question:
What is the order of the symmetric group S₃?

Consider: Sₙ is the group of all permutations of n elements
tasks.hint: Count the number of possible permutations of 3 elements

tasks.title: Ring Theory Operations
tasks.question:
Implement basic ring theory operations and checks.

Your functions should:

  • Verify ring properties (addition and multiplication)
  • Find ring units and zero divisors
  • Check if ring is commutative or has identity
  • Calculate ring characteristics
  • Handle polynomial rings
tasks.hint: Check ring axioms, find elements with multiplicative inverses for units
